cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward a southeastern Louisiana landfall, then expected to slow, move north through Louisiana and western Mississippi, and turn northeast toward the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (and Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama/Florida border; Storm Surge Warning – East of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA, to the Alabama/Florida border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama coasts, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (39–57 mph) with gusts possibly approaching 50–60 mph expected Monday as the center passes to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft possible along the Alabama coast and within Mobile Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Monday; dangerous rip currents and high surf through at least Tuesday
